result.execSummary:
The defendant William D. Rushford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Transfer (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D. Rushford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: County Market ck# 027395 sent this date. eif
Uncashed ck#025258 letter for County Market sent this date. cah

ck # 025258 for $80.65 to County Market for restitution. Sent to victim witness on this date. gme

Uncashed-check letter returned saying they never received their check. Voided and reissued 7-24-17. cah
c: DA, Def, Atty Harrelson and Hudson PD. mw

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  William D. Rushford appeared. Case called at 9:03 a.m. ADA McKinley makes statement. Atty Harrelson states his client has restitution in hand. ADA McKinley gives argument. Defendant makes statement. Court orders:

- Fine $119.35 inclusive of costs

- Restitution in the amount of  $80.65
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
Sentencing hearing at 11-06-2015 09:00 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  William D. Rushford appeared. Case called at 10:53 a.m. ADA McKinley recites agreement. State has complied with victims rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 15CM68. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 RETAIL THEFT in 15CM68. Sentencing argument by Atty Harrelson.  Court will set a sentencing date so defendant can pay the restitution in the amount of $80.65. 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing at 10-27-2015 10:30 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  William D. Rushford appeared. Case called at 1:37 p.m. Atty Harrelson states there is a resolution. Set for a plea hearing. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference at 10-12-2015 01:30 pm
Pre-trial conference at 09-10-2015 09:15 am

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  William D. Rushford appeared. Case called at 3:18 p.m. Court reviews file. ADA McKinley states some discussions have taken place and requesting more time to reach a resolution. Atty Harrelson in agreement. State requesting 45 days. Address confirmed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Francis D. Collins   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  William D. Rushford appeared. Case called at 3:53 p.m. ADA Collins set out 30 days. Bond will continue. hml  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
to State's Discovery Demand. Filed by Atty Harrelson. km
Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

CO: Judge Richards for Branch IV. , RPR: Drost, Clerk: Liddle. ADA Gehler present; Atty Harrelson; William Rushford in person. Case recalled at 10:42 a.m. Atty Harrelson makes statement. Needs time to review discovery and file motions. ADA Gehler fine with continuance and quash warrant. Court grants continuance and quashes warrant. hml

CO: Judge Richards for Branch IV, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Liddle. ,ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  William D. Rushford did not appear. Case called at 10:34 a.m. Atty Harrelson requesting warrant be stayed so he can try and contact his client. Court orders warrant be stayed until April 29, 2015 at 4:00 p.m. hml
